creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: small human figure or baby floating on back in air, stretching PR arm over head, with PL shoulder and arm bent awkwardly downward, connecting to the hand of a female body mostly submerged under water; rolling hills and clouds in background
image_copyright: © Plattsburgh State Art Museum. All rights reserved.
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Label

label on drawing\'s backing sheet, typewritten: DONATED BY Helen Read Trend $250. | Original drawing by Rockwell Kent - / given to my mother by the artist | 

also on this label, a signature in blue pen: Helen Appleton Read - Portraits, Inc. 

label on back of frame: University Gallery / University of Minnesota / Minneapolis, Minnesota 55455 / No. X1 / Exh. Rockwell Kent: Graphics / Date in: Mar. 28, 1974 ship by hand.
medium: Pen and brush and black ink
provenance: Collection of the artist; given to Helen Appleton Read (1897-1974), New York; her daughter, Helen Read Trent. John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn., at least by March 28, 1974; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed and inscribed in ink, bottom right margin: [To H.R.  Rockwell Kent]
title: Drowning Woman
